title: Changing the colour of a van.......

posts.content:
Right, so I'm looking at a few vans and I've spotted a couple of really nice ones but the missus isn't pushed on the colour so couple of questions.....

Is it ok to change the colour away from original or does that make me a w***er?

Can any decent respray shop do it or do I need a specialist for a classic?

Is a colour change going to decrease resale value?

rashersoflaois wrote:
Is it ok to change the colour away from original or does that make me a w***er?

Not neccesarily, unless you change it to yellow

Can any decent respray shop do it or do I need a specialist for a classic?

Any decent shop can do it, but get more than one quote and try to see their work.

Is a colour change going to decrease resale value?

Possibly, but also depending how original the rest of the van is, it would for me.

as above as for colour affecting price not sure it would to be honest theres lots of VW colours to choose from and an even greater choice if you look at other marques and newer colours as long as you don,t go to jazzy bright purple or orange , yellow etc
Thanks lads, not thinking of anything crazy colour wise, I've seen a couple that are either an odd colour or single colour, would prefer White & dark blue or White & red or something

just take your time choosing check out as many combos as you can if you have a body shop in mind for the work they should have colour chips you can take home and peruse at your leisure you,d be amazed at the choice and variation in colours the hardest part if your going for something of your own choice will be visualising it on a vehicle
